wikipedia_page.main: Robert Downie (19 March 1867 in Glasgow – 27 July 1893) was a Scottish footballer who played for Thornliebank, Third Lanark and Scotland as a goalkeeper. He was a Scottish Cup winner in 1889.

response: Robert Downie (1894–1968) was a Scottish recipient of the VC for leading a major charge in World War I.
Robert Downie may also refer to:
*Robert Downie (footballer) (1867–1893), Scottish footballer, played for Scotland in 1892
*Robert Downie (rower), British double world champion lightweight rower
